script.narration: It's the night before the Super Bowl.
script.description: A small, dimly lit sports bar, neon lights flickering. An overweight, aging man sits alone at the bar, eating a burger and nursing a beer. Football highlights play on a TV overhead.

script.dialogue:
Bartender: You here for the big game tomorrow?
Engineer (sighing): Just me and my code, as always.
script.description: The bartender leans over, chatting with the engineer, who looks tired and a bit sad.
Close-up of the engineer’s phone lighting up, displaying 'ON-CALL INCIDENT: URGENT'. His face falls.

script.dialogue: Engineer (hurried): I’ve got to go. Can you box this up?
script.description: The engineer stands, scrambling to gather his things, leaving his meal and half-finished beer behind.
The engineer runs through cold, empty streets, clutching his laptop bag. The city glows in the distance.
He bursts into his cluttered apartment, greeted by flashing red lights on his computer and an urgent email: 'FBI NEEDS ASSISTANCE - SUPER BOWL AT RISK!'

script.dialogue: FBI Agent (on video call): Your software is down! We can’t coordinate security. The Super Bowl might be cancelled!
script.description: On his monitor, a stern FBI agent pleads for help, surrounded by frantic officials.

script.dialogue: Engineer (panicking): This can’t be happening... I need backup!
script.description: Sweat beads on his brow as he grabs his phone, dialing frantically.

script.dialogue: Engineer (shouting): Team! We’re going all hands! Super Bowl’s on the line!
script.description: A group chat explodes with notifications. His teammates – diverse, tired but determined – pop up on screens, logging in from their homes.

script.narration: The real heroes get to work.
script.description: A montage of the team furiously typing, screens filled with code and error logs, determination in their eyes.

script.dialogue: Engineer (relieved, to FBI): Try it now.
script.description: He sits back, exhausted, as the FBI agent gives a thumbs up on the screen.

script.narration: The Super Bowl is saved – all thanks to the unlikely heroes behind the code.
script.description: The engineer slumps back in his chair, smiling faintly as fireworks go off outside his window, the glow of the Super Bowl celebration lighting up the night.

storyboard.description: Wide shot of a sparsely populated sports bar at night. The engineer, overweight, balding, and looking lonely, sits at the bar with a burger and beer. Football plays on a screen above.
Medium shot. The bartender leans in, making small talk. The engineer responds with a tired smile, revealing his solitude.
Close-up on the engineer’s phone ringing on the bar. His hand hesitates above it, his face a mix of dread and resignation.
Action shot. The engineer stands abruptly, grabbing his bag, leaving unfinished food and beer behind. The bartender looks on, a bit surprised.
Nighttime city street. The engineer hurries home, bundled against the cold, city lights glowing in the fog.
Interior, cluttered apartment. The engineer throws open the door, his computer screens flashing with red alerts.
Zoomed-in shot of his laptop screen. A video call with a worried FBI agent, agency office chaos in the background.
Close-up. Engineer wipes sweat from his brow, frantically dialing his phone, panic in his eyes.
Split screen showing his teammates logging in from various locations – bedrooms, kitchens, coffee shops – all looking serious and ready.
Montage. Team members typing, code scrolling, error messages resolving, intense concentration everywhere.
Back to the engineer's apartment. He leans forward, hopeful, as the FBI agent on screen gives a relieved thumbs up.
Wide shot. The engineer leans back, exhausted but smiling, as fireworks from the Super Bowl celebration glow outside his window.
